review: Doctor is awesome,knee soiling and pain has reduced .. well explained about my pain and treatment and suggest what to do or not in detailed.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review:
I consulted Dr. Akhilesh Rathi as I had a disc prolapse and the condition was so bad that my left leg was in immense pain and partial numbness. I couldn’t move my leg. Dr. Rathi suggested a minimal invasive procedure microdiscectomy. I was afraid with the name of spine surgery but I was amazed as soon as I woke up after surgery and my leg was completely fine. I walked the same day and I walk perfectly now.
I highly recommend Dr. Rathi and would like to thank him for the surgery and his polite and professional attitude towards his patients.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review:
I have been privileged to meet. Dr. Rathi who treated me for a back problem for a long time. Dr. Rathi always asked questions, spend sufficient time to understanding the problem, explain the situation well and was never eager/quick to simply recommend any tests just like that, more importantly, he was always accommodating to answer any question I had. A visit to Dr. Rathi was always a wonderful experience, plus he conditions a positive mindset which instills confidence in the patient. 

I always found him to be very professional, thorough and confident about his prognosis. The care, service, and results were of the highest level possible. Without a spec of reservation, I strongly recommend Dr. Rathi to anyone who needs any kind of orthopedic intervention.

tags: None
review: Doctor advised that my finger was fractured and suggested plaster. After getting all wrapped up I was presented with an invoice of 6k. The person at the reception couldn’t even get the math right as it was only amounting to 5.3k. Ideally when a treatment is being offered the costs should also be disclosed so that the patient can make an informed decision. Surprisingly the doctor was kind to offer me a discount. I just felt the whole thing was rushed and I was merely treated as a transaction that needed to happen so the consultation could move on to the next patient. There were no after care instructions - dos/dont’s provided.  He might be a good doctor but I expected more from him. Also I’m not quite pleased with the results - still in pain and now resorting to another doctor. My candid feedback that should be worked on to elevate the experience being offered to the patients.
reply_text:
Appreciate your suggestions and feedback.

All the charges  are displayed in reception and these are the routine charges all across dwarka.

Normally all those patients who ask about charges are told the charges. 

Still after this experience I would ensure that the patient should pay the the charges before hand so that there is no comfusion.

You already mentioned that u were given a discount- u paid total of 3000- (700 consultation plus 600 xray and 1700 for plaster- so in plaster charges u were given a discount of  approx 60 percent) as I told u to give watever you want.

I beg to differ regarding the rushing of things.  

I clearly remember that we had a discussion about treatment. Even surgery was an option if u want to avoid any deformity in hand but as we discussed functionally plaster would suffice. And as plaster is sufficient we planned for plaster management.

All your questions were answered.

Dos and donts are mentioned in your prescription if you see.

Also I try to answer all questions of the patients.

In my prescription I have given my watsapp number which i reply usually the same day.

Regarding pain , its just 10 days , fracture healing takes time and you were asked to do follow up after 5 days  which you did not.

I am still open for any discussion regarding management.

Best wishes

tags: Treatment satisfaction,Explanation of the health issue,Doctor friendliness,Value for money,Wait time,
review: Dr.Akhilesh Rathi treated and operated on my knee for ACL reconstruction. I was going through a great pain in my knee and was not able to walk. But thanks to his treatment i am now able to walk without any support brace or stick. He also advised and motivated me for physiotherapy to fasten my healing process which yielded fruitful results for me. He has always been very motivating, caring and friendly. He is a great orthopaedic surgeon. I am really grateful and indebted to him throughtout my life.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Value for money,Treatment satisfaction,
review: Dr. Rathi is an extremely capable and experienced doctor who gives relevant advice. He does not over medicate. He believes that if an ailment can be cured with minimal medicinal intervention, it's better and proceeds to advanced treatment only if required. He explains the entire problem to the patient in layman language for better understanding. Have been consulting him for my entire family's orthopaedic problems for the past 10 years and I'm fully satisfied.

Dr. Akhilesh was extremely patient to hear me out and he followed up with a thorough physical examination. 
He explained in detail the cause of the problem, preventive measures, and exercises to strengthen the affected part of neck and shoulder.
The prescribed medications are efficient in mitigating the pain and are a saviour for me. 
I recommend Dr. Akhilesh to all near and dear ones without a second thought. 
Thank You

tags: Value for money,
review: Online consultancy was showing 400 but they have charged 600.  I think online appointment payment must be available to avoid this overcharging by doctor.
reply_text:
Charges have been revised to 500 long time back.

On sunday the charges are 600 , sunday being a holiday.

We dont know where have you seen Rs 400 , do let us know if you have the exact link of where you saw the charges as lot of websites put the charges on there own without our consent.

Maximum patients book through practo and practo does not have the option of differential charging so we cant help.

tags: Value for money,Treatment satisfaction,
review: 1 x-ray was enough, instead he taken 2. Root cause not identified. Doctor is friendly and wait time is less but he should be pro-active to find root cause of issue.
reply_text:
GOOD EVENING SIR,

WOULD LIKE TO CLARIFEY ON YOUR ISSUES.

HOPE YOU TAKE SOME TIME TO READ IT OUT.

ANY FOOT ISSUE REQUIRES TWO X RAYS SO BOTH AP AND OBLIQUE VIEWS WERE DONE. THATS THE STANDARD PROTOCOL ALL OVER THE WORLD, SO TWO X RAYS WERE DONE.

ROOT CAUSE AT TIMES CANNOT BE IDENTIFIED BY CLINICAL EXAMINATION AND X RAYS.

FINDING ROOT CAUSE MAY INVOLVE COSTLY AND INCONVENIENT TESTS LIKE MRI ,SO WE TRY TO FIND ROOT CAUSE  IN PATIENTS WITH PROBLEM LIKE YOURS  ONLY  IF WE ARE SUSPECTING ANYTHING SERIOUS /IF THE TREATMENT CHANGES BY FINDING THE ROOT CAUSE .


AS WE WERE NOT SUSPECTING ANYTHING SERIOUS IN YOUR  CASE ,ONLY X RAY WAS DONE TO RULE OUT COMMON ISSUES.

WE ARE ALWAYS OPEN TO YOUR QUESTIONS AND DISCUSSIONS TO EXPLAIN WHAT WE ARE SUSPECTING AND ALSO TO EXPLAIN THE COURSE OF YOUR DISEASE.

MOST PATIENTS RECOVER WITH THE TREATMENT GIVEN TO YOU IN YOUR PROBLEM.


GET WELL SOON.

REGARDS

DR AKHILESH RATHI

tags: Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,
review:
We have visited doctor.. we are not very much satisfied with the opinion..

Doctor not satisfied us with the treatment.* ***** ****** ****** **like you can go for plaster if you want or you can leave if you don’t want.. so no clear suggestions 

Although he was nice talking and less waiting time but...
reply_text:
As doctors we are supposed to tell you all options available.
There is no one best solution for every problem.

Every solution has its pros and coms.

Toe walking is a benign condition which improves with age and physio.

Plaster correction is advised for selective patients but it has its share of problems.

All options were discussed and treatment plan was given .
